data.title: A timeline of Anna Faris and Chris Pratt's relationship and subsequent divorce
data.meta_description: Chris Pratt and Anna Faris broke everyone's hearts when they announced their break up. Here's a look back at their love story.
data.text:
This story is available exclusively to Business Insider subscribers. Become an Insider and start reading now. Have an account? .

Chris Pratt and Anna Faris were one of Hollywood's most beloved couples.

The two married in 2009 but finalized their divorce in 2018, although they are still on good terms.

Here's a timeline of their relationship, divorce, and friendship.

Advertisement

Chris Pratt and Anna Faris were generally regarded as one of the sweetest couples in Hollywood. They shared their love of dead bugs, their "ritual" of Pratt braiding Faris' hair, and her love of feeding him, even as he dropped weight for roles.

That's why so many were stunned when the couple announced their split on social media. They filed for divorce in December 2017, allegedly because they both had different goals for their family life.

If you're hurting as much as we are, lick your wounds and take a look back at the couple's love story in happier times.

Advertisement

2007: They met on the set of "Take Me Home Tonight."

Though the pair grew up in Washington state about 20 minutes away from each other, they didn't meet until they were both in Los Angeles and filming the movie "Take Me Home Tonight."

Faris was still married to actor Ben Indra at the time and the pair has sworn nothing happened while she was still married.

Though they made the film in 2007, the film was released in 2011 after being stalled for the depictions of cocaine use. Pratt shared their love story at the premiere, saying, "This is a pretty spectacular moment for us, to be able to come to this movie that we met on and fell in love making."

Advertisement

2007: Anna left her husband and Chris said he always knew they'd be together.

Faris and Indra filed for divorce in 2007. Pratt said that he knew she was "The One" the moment they met and that once Faris was single, the two of them were going to be together.

Advertisement

2007: They had an adorable dating period.

Pratt and Faris are two self-described goofballs and it make sense that while they dated, they showed that side off.

Pratt recounted how before they were officially dating, he left pornographic magazines out and Faris didn't seem to mind.

Once they began dating, Pratt also left out his framed African stick bug and Faris told The New Yorker she got emotional because she found someone else who collected dead bugs like she did.

Faris and Pratt also had a day called "sex-text Wednesday" where they would designate time to sext each other, she told the AP. That came to an end when she sent a "small child" a text about getting drunk.

Advertisement

2008: They got engaged and Chris got a ring, too.

Pratt popped the question to Faris with a gorgeous ring — so gorgeous, in fact, that Pratt got himself an engagement ring, too!

He eventually upgraded Faris's engagement ring in 2016, telling People magazine that Faris had gotten him a tractor, so they were even.

Advertisement

2009: They got married and there were punches thrown.

The couple got married in a small ceremony in Bali in 2009. Not much is known about the wedding, but Pratt revealed to Us Weekly that he loved it — even if some punches were thrown.

"The best parts of my 2009 wedding were seeing my wife with flowers in her hair, the two families coming together, heartfelt speeches — and a pretty great fistfight on the dance floor," he said.

Advertisement

2012: Anna gave birth to their son, Jack.

Faris and Pratt welcomed their son Jack in August 2012, 9 weeks premature. He spent a month in the NICU, and needed hernia surgery, and the pair were told he would likely have special needs.

"I made promises in that moment about what kind of dad I wanted to be and I just prayed that he'd live long enough that I could keep them," Pratt said when relaying the story at a benefit for March of Dimes.

Jack had to get cosmetic surgery to correct his eyes, but after that, the couple was able to take him home, and now he has no developmental problems besides needing glasses.

Advertisement

2013: Pratt got buff for "Guardians of the Galaxy," but Faris preferred him a little softer.

While Pratt's 60-pound weight loss for his role in "Guardians of The Galaxy" cemented him as a sex symbol, he told Digital Spy that Faris was not a big fan of his new bod.

"She likes abs, but she likes her fat husband better because she gets to feed him," he said.

Pratt joked that Faris was a "feeder."

"She's a feeder and she wants to keep me locked up in the bedroom all fat and eating Kentucky Fried Chicken," he continued.

Pratt later told Stephen Colbert that Faris missed cooking for him.

Advertisement

2014: Pratt showed off his braiding skills.

The internet totally melted when Pratt shared an Instagram post of his French braiding skills.

Apparently it was a ritual that Pratt would braid her hair at night before they went to sleep. But the braids were doing too much damage, so Pratt revealed that Faris' mother taught him how to French braid to do less harm.

"Anna's mom thought a French braid might distribute the pressure," he told InStyle. "She taught me when we were in Hawaii shooting 'Jurassic World.'"

Advertisement

2015: Pratt said that their relationship made him believe in "divine intervention."

Pratt gushed about Faris during a Reddit AMA, saying that because they had so much in common, their relationship caused him to believe in "divine intervention."

"Anna and I are meant to be together," he wrote. "Our relationship has made me believe in divine intervention and destiny, just as much as my crazy career and the way I fell into this life."

"She and I grew up 20 minutes away from each other but never met until we met in LA. We both got our start in horror spoofs. We both did an animated movie for Phil Lord and Chris Miller," he added. "We both made our careers playing guileless nitwits for laughs. We both have parents that have suffered with MS. The similarities go on and on."

Pratt concluded that "Anna is a great wife. Very patient and understanding. Very supportive. So kind and genuine always. And she gave me a wonderful son and family of in laws that I truly love."

Advertisement

2015: They said they dreamed of owning a farm together one day.

Faris and Pratt told Entertainment Tonight that their biggest piece of relationship advice was to keep their "eyes on the prize."

"These are the work years. The gravy years are to come," Pratt said. "The way we work it out is we just take at least one moment every day to be present with one another. Whether or not we're in the same room, or the same state, or even the same country, we check in, you know?"

One of the prizes? Owning a farm together one day.

"Were so lucky that we have the same sense of humor," Faris said. "We dream about having a little bit of a farm one day."

Advertisement

2016: Pratt took six months off for "family time."

After some crazy years filming two "Guardians of The Galaxy" movies, "Jurassic World," and "Passengers," Pratt revealed he was going to take some time off to vacation with his family.

"I've been on the road for 14 months — I did three movies back to back to back — so I'm taking six months off," he told Parade magazine. "I'm taking Jack to Jack's Beach — which is what we named the little stretch of beach on an island up on the San Juan Islands where we got a place. We're going to go back to the fort we built about a month and a half ago when we went for a short visit and see if that's still there. If not, we're going to build it again."

Advertisement

2016: Faris said the tabloid rumors took a toll on them.

Though Pratt and Faris had been stars for quite some time, when Pratt became a leading man, she said she had some tough times with the spotlight.

During a conversation with actress Isla Fisher on her podcast "Anna Faris Is Unqualified," Faris said that cheating rumors surrounding Pratt made her feel hurt.

"I just remember feeling so hurt in a way that bothered me, because I didn't want to think of myself as somebody who could be bothered by tabloid s---," she said, according to People magazine.

"I take pride in how great my relationship is with Chris, but having said that, of course, in this crazy world where he's off doing movies and I'm in LA raising our child, of course I'm going to feel vulnerable, like any normal human would," she continued.

Advertisement

2017: Pratt shared some sweet snaps.

With Pratt's work break, the pair were out of the spotlight for a bit, but kept their #relationshipgoals title by sharing some sweet photos of each other online.

Pratt wished Faris a happy Mother's Day in the US and in Europe, while Faris posted a photo of Pratt and their son Jack together.

Advertisement

2017: They announced their separation.

On August 6, 2017, Pratt and Faris announced their split on social media.

In matching social media posts. the pair said that they were "disappointed" and asked for privacy.

"Anna and I are sad to announce we are legally separating," the post said. "We tried hard for a long time, and we're really disappointed. Our son has two parents who love him very much and for his sake we want to keep this situation as private as possible moving forward. We still have love for each other, will always cherish our time together and continue to have the deepest respect for one another."

Advertisement

2017: They officially filed for divorce.

The couple made their break up official when they simultaneously filed for divorce in December, according to TMZ.

Despite announcing their split in August, their divorce papers listed their official date of separation as July 13.

They both asked in their divorce filings for joint custody of their son Jack and the right to receive child support, but as TMZ noted, it's unlikely either will ask for it.

Advertisement

2018: The divorce was finalized.

In October 2018, TMZ reported that Pratt and Faris has officially signed divorce papers with a private judge.

TMZ wrote that Faris' divorce lawyer Laura Wasser requested a private judge from the courts to speed up the process of the divorce.

The site also reported that the former couple had a prenup, and that they officially requested and were given joint custody of their son, Jack, who was 6 at the time.

Advertisement

2019: Faris offered to Chris Pratt's wedding to Katherine Schwarzenegger

In January 2019, Pratt announced that he and his new partner Katherine Schwarzenegger were engaged.

Shortly after this, Faris revealed on her podcast "Anna Faris is Unqualified" that Pratt texted her to share the news.

"Chris texted me this morning and he was like, you know, 'I proposed to Katherine last night,'" Faris said. "I was like 'Ah! That's amazing.'

"And I texted him back: 'Just want to remind you, I'm an ordained minister.'"

Advertisement

2019: Pratt told Insider that he and Faris maintain a healthy relationship "naturally."

In 2019 while promoting a pop-up Lego cafe as part of the promotion for "The Lego Movie 2," Pratt spoke to Insider's Rachel Hosie about how he maintains a good relationship with Faris.

"It just happens naturally for us," Pratt said, explaining that they ensure to put their son, Jack, before anything else. "Kids first, it's more important. Kids want to be in a loving household. Put them first, put your kids first. That's the key I think."

Advertisement

2019: Faris said there is still 'so much kindness and love' between her and Pratt.

In 2019, Faris appeared on the podcast "Divorce Sucks!" explaining that although her and Pratt's romantic relationship had ended, their committment, respect, and love for one another had not.

"We are so good and respectful towards each other, and I think that there is so much kindness and love," Faris said. "It is very difficult to be completely separate from somebody you have spent so much emotional investment with."

Advertisement

2020: Faris congratulated Pratt on his newborn baby with Schwarzenegger.

In August 2020, Pratt and his wife Schwarzenegger announced the birth of their first baby together, Lydia.

E! News reported that a source close to the couple told them that Faris congratulated Pratt and Schwarzenegger on the news and sent them a gift.

The source told E! News: "They are on good terms and have a nice relationship. She's happy for Jack to be a big brother and is very supportive."

Advertisement

2021: Faris gets engaged to Michael Barratt and reveals 'competitiveness' ended her marriage with Pratt.

While the divorce shocked fans of the couple, there wasn't much news around what exactly caused the break up.

It wasn't until March 2021 that Faris, who by this point was engaged to cinematography Michael Barratt, offered some insight as to why she and Pratt ended their marriage, explaining that "competitiveness" played a role in the break down of their relationship.

Faris was speaking to Gwyneth Paltrow on her podcast about her two previous marriages. Faris was previoulsy married to actor Ben Indra from 2004 to 2008 before she was wed to Pratt.

"My two other marriages were with actors and I don't think we did a great job of eliminating competitiveness. Or at least I didn't, being a proud person, and not wanting to reveal vulnerability," Faris said.

"Any hint of competitiveness and comparison, I didn't handle that very well, I don't think. And I hope I've grown from that."

Advertisement

2021: Faris said her 'hand was forced' in their divorce.

Faris opened up further about her divorce from Pratt in May 2021, again during an episode of her podcast.

The actress told guest Rachel Bilson: "For me, I think after every breakup, at some point I realize that there were a lot of things I ignored that I really shouldn't have."

"In hindsight, it felt like my hand was forced. I don't think it was ever an independent decision."
